If you load a resource of size 0, loadresource doesnt set its destination
property, nor does it print anything meaningful, even at the -debug level.

I added a log statement.

text: That's certainly one option; the other is to set the property to ""
creator: stevel@apache.org
jan@materne.de
text:
Yes. But the old behaviour is not setting the property, so I have chosen that.
If you need a set property, you could always do a
   <loadresource property="p"> ...
   <property name="p" value=""/>

With that in mind I skipped the idea of a new attribute "setwhenempty" or
something like that ...
